DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Study Continuous Intraarticular Infusion Patients Undergoing Arthroscopic Knee Shoulder Operations
DOC.detailed_description: We propose evaluate long-term efficacy continuous intraarticular delivery local anesthetic via disposable , self-regulated DonJoy Pain Control infusion pump . Patients randomly assign receive either intra-articular infusion bupivacaine 0.125 % , saline deliver rate 5 ml/hr 48 hour DonJoy® Pain Control infusion pump . Patients receive femoral block ( FNB ) sciatic block ( SNB ) knee arthroscopy interscalene block ( INB ) shoulder arthroscopy prior surgery . After operation , patient receive morphine via Patient Controlled Analgesia ( PCA ) pump pain control . The patient admit overnight Care Unit , PCA discontinue discharge 24 hour , whichever earlier . If clinically indicate , PCA may extend discretion pain team . Upon discharge 48 hour study period patient receive oral oxycodone acetaminophen . The patient family remove DonJoy® Pain Control infusion pump 48 hour surgery .
